cause.description:
Fresh vegetarian food carried on bicycles filling stomachs in the name of Jesus.
The Hospitality Train is hospitality on wheels. It is a community meal for the streets. We prepare fresh, healthy meals utilizing vegetables from our community garden, as well as other organic ingredients.
The Hospitality Train is sponsored by Missio Dei, a mennonite church in the Cedar Riverside neighborhood.
The idea is simple: we load up our bikes and trikes, bringing fresh ingredients and high quality portable cooking equipment to feed people good food. Along with food preparers/servers, we are sometimes joined by musicians who will play as we serve food.
For more info, visit: www.missio-dei.com/hospitality-train
To give directly, visit missio-dei.com and select "giving" at the top.
Or email the project coordinator: ellens.joshua@gmail.com
1. Hospitality is central to the way of Jesus.
2. Food is a great way to build community.
3. Everyone needs to eat.
